title: So we are nerfing Thornmail, Omen, Frozen heart, and Dead Man's all on the same patch.
body:
I mean really? Dead man's? Really? It seems the ONLY reason for nerfing Dead Man's is they went "man, fuck melee, thinking they're so cool."

You can't nerf all the full tank items, then turn around and nerf the damage items too. You're only giving melee two new items, one of which is a bargin bin discount mid game item that will have the same problem Tahm's shield does where it pisses low ELO off cause "omg scary big number!" but the rapidly decaying part actually renders it far less useful than it appears to be. The other is a side-grade to Hydra which ALREADY got nerfed to +5 damage on auto from +20.

But why Dead Man's? It's barely been out for a patch and we're already nerfing it? Not Rylais which is being built every game on Viktor to perma kite/chase? Not BT which lets ADCs heal any and all poke you do to them? Not even a nerf to LW/VS as you're butchering all the tank items? Not Luden's which continues to be OP as shit?

No, but we're nerfing Dead Man's. An item that has been out for a week. You know the last time Riot nerfed an item in a week? Literally fucking never. Innervating Locket lasted for months before Riot touched it. Sunfire lasted for like half a year. Luden's Echo took a month. Hourglass lasted 3 years. But dead man's? An item that the only person I've seen it on is me? Nerf that fucking shit after a WEEK. Athen's holy grail basically won the S2 finals, and then took another season to nerf.

Not BT which lets ADCs heal any and all poke you do to them? Not even a nerf to LW/VS as you're butchering all the tank items? Not Luden's which continues to be OP as shit?

Nerfing an item can be a good idea even if it's currently not seen as the most op item in the game. First, there may not even be close to full agreement that Rylai's, BT, LW, or Luden's being OP, and for what it's worth, I'm not necessarily saying that Dead Man's is or isn't more OP than any of these other items.

That said, it does seem like a sound logical approach to me, though not necessarily the only approach that could work, to try to systematically balance many or all of the Armor items in the game toward a similar goal in the same patch. What I believe the designers are trying to do with Dead Man's plate and the other armor items out there (Randuin's, Sunfire, etc.), is make it so that when you are choosing which item you want to buy, you're doing it mostly for the unique effects that they're giving you rather than being most cost efficient, which is more what players are used to.

I can't say with certainty that this approach will leave Armor items in a good spot in 5.16, but it really does sound to me like it will put them in a spot where their balance is easier to understand and adjust.

Now, the approach that you seem to be suggesting is that we should have a sort of tier list of all the most OP items in the game, and be nerfing the ones at the top. That may be oversimplified, but honestly, it may also be a valid way to do things, and is probably more akin to how we've done things in the past.

I'd actually be interesting in hearing people's opinions on whether the approach being taken to Armor items in 5.16 (without consideration to exact numbers) is a preferred approach as opposed to a method that is more constantly taking things off the top.

Rito has made this EXACT SAME mistake in the past--double nerfing a group of champions the same patch. This feels like quadruple-nerfing, this time. Last year before worlds every single tank item was nerfed (RIP {{item:3143}} movespeed debuff) and ADC items were simultaneously buffed. This led to one of the worst game balances in history during Worlds. 

{{champion:18}} was "pick, ban, or lose" and the only tanks that were viable in the meta were {{champion:57}} {{champion:12}} and ONLY because their kits gave them innate tankyness. Top lane meta was completely ruined and got reduced to cancerous champions like {{champion:13}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:117}} 

The same will happen this year if not worse in Worlds. there will be 1 or less tank per game (and I'm going to guess that tank will be {{champion:57}} or {{champion:12}} surprise surprise), mark my words. Is this Goundhog's Day?? Why does Rito ALWAYS make this mistake and expect a different result? Literally every bit of progress made this season in making tanks viable again will be COMPLETELY undone if these 5.16 changes go through. It's not too late to stop them @RiotRepertoir please cancel these changes before it's too late. The tank meta ended many patches ago. Watch any game now. Tanks are only played in top lane and maybe support. Even then, there are other non-tank champions in those roles that are just as viable. 

{{item:3075}} 's numbers literally have not been changed since 2010 and 2009. It's currently the least popular armor item in the game. Given a choice of ANY ONE armor item, most champions prefer to buy {{item:3143}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3026}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3047}} .

There was a time when {{item:3110}} used to give 15% CDR, 90 armor, and 20% attack speed debuff (Season 2/3) and NOBODY bought it because it was also expensive. We are returning to those times.

{{item:3143}} ALREADY got nerfed last year and until you bring back the 10% movespeed debuff on-hit there is nothing to justify nerfing it further. It's new crit reduction passive is a total joke. So which is it? Is {{item:3143}} supposed to be good against crits or against speed? The 5.16 nerfs make it shitty at BOTH.

These changes literally decrease strategic diversity. There's not a single good reason for any of these changes. The only think I can see is "well it's almost time for Worlds time to make flashy damage champions strong again {{champion:64}} must always be top pick". Rito has consistently shown bias against tanky melee champions. Any time there's any change to make them viable, they are almost immediately nerfed back into oblivion. What's the fucking pont?

> So which is it? Is (Randuin's) supposed to be good against crits or against speed? The 5.16 nerfs make it shitty at BOTH.

I know this wasn't the only thing you asked, but I believe it's supposed to be the clear choice against basic attackers, not necessarily just crits or just attack speed.

To the more general point, I don't think the point of the whole suite of changes is "to make Armor bad," though many seem to be reading it that way. There seems to be two main vocal groups of players when it comes to discussions like this, those that think adcs are too strong, and those that think they are too weak. Naturally, the former group will be more vocal about the subject matter of this thread, and I'm not saying you shouldn't be necessarily. It's more just that I am pretty confident that your opinions on the Armor changes are not necessarily the overwhelming majority.

To be perfectly clear, I don't fall strongly into the "adcs are too weak" category, nor do I fall too strongly into the "adcs are too strong (armor is too weak)" category. I do, however, think that if the goals of changes to armor items is to put all armor items on a somewhat level playing field, then _that line of thinking specifically_ is a good one, and I hope that these changes help to accomplish that.

Will armor be too weak in 5.16? Maybe. Would the game be more balanced if we were also nerfing penetration items and possibly BotRK? Possibly. One of the great things about League of Legends when it comes to issues like this is that we adjust balance very regularly, and there are still two patches following 5.16 before the Worlds patch, so I'm confident that if something was sorely off, it could be accounted for. I can say with very high certainty that no one on the balance or systems team is saying "we don't want to see tanks at Worlds."

takeing caits base values for the example, which are rather on the low side:
AD: 101+(80+40+80+80+8(runes)+14(masteries))*1.05(masteries)) = 418AD
AS: 0.625 X (1+68%(base AS-growth)+25%+55%+15%(runes)+5%(masteries)) = 1,675AS

dps = AD x AS x (1+(critchance x crit damage) = 418 x 1,675 x 1,825 = ~1277,8

I apologize if this has been asked before, but WHY exactly is it ok for Armor to get weaker overall as a side effect of the changes? Do you guys really feel like people in general are getting too tanky vs AD right now?

Sometimes it feels like you do random stuff just for the sake of changing things up, but the community values balance far more than it values change. In fact, we really don't like change all that much unless it is obviously for the better.

I think everyone could probably agree that it would be okay for Armor to get relatively weaker _IF_ it was overall too strong. What is clearly not agreed upon, or at least rejected by many in this thread in particular, is that Armor is in fact stronger than it needs to be at the moment. As to whether Riot collectively feels that people in general are too tanky vs AD right now, I'm really not the person to make that call (since it's not my specialty nor my team's). I understand that may sound like a cop out, but it's probably not fair for me to make a decisive yes/no call on whether the balance and item guys think Armor too strong when I am not a primary driver of change for those teams.

I would hope it doesn't feel like we make change for the sake of change, though since change is something we do quite often, I can see how one would get that impression. Currently, it wouldn't surprise me if someone said we probably believe that we are continually making change that is for the better more than the community at large shares that belief.

well, it´s pretty obvious that adcs and ranged/mobile champs in general dominate the game while melees (even more so immobile melees/anything that needs to get tanky) are very rarly seen...all of those changes only further fuel this trend. And unless Juggnauts will be incredible overpowered this will be the least sucessfull rework project of all times, as they will never reach a fight alive vs coordinated teams.

Rather than looking for consensus, I'm more concerned with the question of what evidence is there to suggest that armor is too strong? Are tanks too overbearing? Are we seeing too many fighters stacking armor and being unkillable? What do the statistics say? Is the meta trending in an unhealthy direction because people can just get armor to win?

I'm not saying that you guys are actually applying it in this situation, but for the record I strongly disagree with a philosophy of balancing a game based on how things feel or how they are perceived or "what might be cool". I think an "If it's not broken, don't fix it." mentality is much more healthy because it gives things room to evolve naturally which is largely more valuable than a balance team trying to be the ones to drive the change.

After all, as often as not, perceptions are proven to be false (including the balance team's perceptions >.>) and the most solid and interesting changes in the meta are the ones that arise within the community out of player experimentation and natural growth.
